All Implemented Interfaces:
CriteriaSerializer<Object>, SerializationSupport<Object>, Serializer<Object>
public class ArraySerializer
extends BaseSerializer<Object>

Default serializer for Java native arrays.

Author:
Michele Mostarda (mostarda@fbk.eu)

public boolean acceptClass(Class clazz,
                           Annotation[] annotations)
Description copied from interface: CriteriaSerializer
Checks if the serializer accepts the class.

Parameters:
clazz - class input.
Returns:
true if accepted, false otherwise.

isComplex

public boolean isComplex()
Returns:
true if the serialization must be done in two steps, false otherwise.

getIdentifier

public Identifier getIdentifier(SerializationContext context,
                                Object array,
                                Annotation[] annotations,
                                TripleSet buffer)
Description copied from interface: Serializer
Returns the identifier of the serialized object before performing the serialization itself.

Parameters:
context - context used to serialize the T object.
array - target object.
annotations - annotations associated to the object.
buffer - triple set buffer used to store triples representing the serialization result.
Returns:
the identifier of the serialization.

serialize

public Identifier serialize(SerializationContext context,
                            Object array,
                            Annotation[] annotations,
                            TripleSet buffer)
                     throws SerializationException
Description copied from interface: SerializationSupport
Serializes the given object in a triple set.

Parameters:
context - context used to serialize the T object.
array - target object.
annotations - annotations associated to the object.
buffer - triple set buffer used to store triples representing the serialization result.
Returns:
the result of serialization, if a complex object has been serialized, the identifier of such serialization.
Throws:
SerializationException - if something went wrong during the serialization process.
